intro: Euaraliopsis palmipes, commonly known as the slender euaraliopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Euaraliopsis palmipes is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
